oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Lameness Treatment Rates in Wisconsin Dairy Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cook, N. B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: lameness
treatment rates
hoof trimming
recurrent cases
new cases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Few studies have documented lameness treatment rates in North American dairy herds. Case definition, ability to detect lame individuals and frequency of delivery of the hoof trimming program significantly impact the incidence of new and recurrent cases.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2004; 297
